So I met a lot of my #rstats twitter heroes (@jaredlander @drob @dataandme @hspter @revodavid) in the last 36 hours and, if you didn’t know this already, they are the ~best people~

.@drob telling us stories about #rstats use / growth from @StackOverflow data is something I’ve taken for granted and now I’m quite sad that’s going away. Still, thanks for all your contributions David! https://t.co/rcFRSUha9s
#rstats is the least disliked programming language, according to @drob’s Analysis. That’s nifty.

This is a fantastically obvious visual pattern. #python growth coming largely from #datacience rather than WebDev or devops (based on tags of stackoverflow questions). Very cool. https://t.co/94lUSLZGCR

@drob @StackOverflow @DataDayTexas Whoa look at @TensorFlow growth of questions. I assume that zeal of curiosity exceeds meaningful use, but who knows. #bigdata #ai #deeplearning https://t.co/mCiptKTDqY

I spent most of the day doing not-#rstats things to broaden my horizons (and that was a good choice), but I can’t pass up @drob’s talk on R users and @StackOverflow. #ddtx18 @DataDayTexas https://t.co/bKpHRThFnb
